moves.2. Nc3: Hmm, not too bad; I'd have gone Nf3. I don't really like blocking my c-pawn in this type of White-setup.
moves.2... c6: This could turn into the Caro-Cann. Via e4.
moves.3... e6: Not one of the best responses. I prefer dxe4.
moves.4... g6: Not sure why Black did this? You?
moves.5. Bf4: Nice place for a Bishop, don't you agree?
moves.6. Bd3 g5: Attacking White's DSB. No big deal.
moves.7. Be5: Not what I'd call the best place for it. I like Be3/Bg3 best.
moves.8. O-O: ??? Even worse! White could have won a free rook!
moves.8... f6 9. Bg3 h5: Black sure has pushed his pawns - alot!
moves.10. h4: ?! Not really the best decision. I prefer h3, you?
moves.13... Bd7 14. b4: Hmm, White seems to be attacking a lot!
moves.14... Nxe4 15. Ndxe4 dxe4 16. Qe2: OK, not entirely bad. I like Bxd7+ Qxd7 Qxd7+ Kxd7 Nxe4.
moves.17... Rh7: If Nf6?! Be5 with an advantage! I think.
moves.18... Re7 19. Bxd7+: ! Still going to win a pawn!
moves.21. Be5: Maybe Nb5 was best so he could go Nc7+/Nd6+
moves.21... Rc8 22. Nd5: ?This just lost a piece. I believe that Nb5! was still okay to do even here.
moves.27... Rxc2 28. Bd4 Rxa2 29. Bc5 b6 30. B: Resigns. I believe that White could have won with the proper play. Please Comment and rate it on the Star system, thanks!
